text: Department of the Treasury Internal Revenue Service
IRM 2.4.11 has been revised to include Program, Scope and Objectives.
IRM 2.4.11, dated January 1, 2009, is superseded.
LMSB, SB/SE, TE/GE, W&I.

) Overview: This IRM section provides an overview of the NMFTM Command Code. and (

) Purpose: This IRM contains procedural steps for use of the NMFTM Command Command code NMFTM establishes Automated Non-Master File (ANMF) tax delinquent account (TDA) data on the Taxpayer Information File (TIF) data base. These are accounts that either: Have become Taxpayer quent Accounts (TDA), or are activated
’d tax modules. (

) Audience: These procedures apply to IRS employees who are responsible the processing of NMFTM records. These employees are located in the following areas: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Business/Self- Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (
) Policy Owner: The Chief Information Officer (CIO) is responsible for ing all aspects of our systems that operate the nation’s tax infrastructure. (
) Program Owner: MITS. (
) Primary Stakeholders: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment. (

) Program Goals: This IRM provides the fundamental knowledge and proce- dural guidance for employees who work with NMFTM cases. By following processes and procedures provided by this IRM, employees will process NMFTM cases in a manner that follows IRS policy and procedures while promoting the best interests of the Government. (
) CC-NMFTM blank deﬁner: • Required initial input • Checks the account status on TIF for the input TIN, MFT Code, and Period • Generates CC-NMFTM
input screen as a valid response; when account is not present on IDRS, or dummy entity is present on IDRS • Generates CC-NMFTM
input screen as a valid response, when the entity is present; but the tax module is not present, or dummy tax module is present (
) CC-NMFTM deﬁner ‘

’: • Generated by CC-NMFTM with blank deﬁner • Displayed when the input TIN is not present on TIF, or when a entity is present • Provides input ﬁelds for the taxpayer’s address, and Business Division Codes, and Form
CLC • Automatically computes the Collection Location Code (CLC), using taxpayer’s zip code. (Note:The computed CLC will be overlaid if a form
CLC is present on the input screen.) • Computes the collection Controlling Service Center Code from the lection Location Code. • Builds the full entity on the TIF data base • Generates CC-NMFTM
input screen as a valid response (
) CC-NMFTM
deﬁner ‘
Primary Stakeholders: Large & Medium-Sized Business, Small Business/Self- Employed, Tax-Exempt & Government Entity’s, and Wage & Investment.
(01-01-2005) Input Deﬁners/Screen Sequences
Required initial input Checks the account status on TIF for the input TIN, MFT Code, and Period Generates CC-NMFTM
input screen as a valid response; when account is not present on IDRS, or dummy entity is present on IDRS Generates CC-NMFTM
input screen as a valid response, when the entity is present; but the tax module is not present, or dummy tax module is present
(2) CC-NMFTM deﬁner ‘1’:

Generated by CC-NMFTM with blank deﬁner Displayed when the input TIN is not present on TIF, or when a dummy entity is present Provides input ﬁelds for the taxpayer’s address, and Business Division Codes, and Form
CLC Automatically computes the Collection Location Code (CLC), using the taxpayer’s zip code. (Note:The computed CLC will be overlaid if a valid form
CLC is present on the input screen.) Computes the collection Controlling Service Center Code from the Col- lection Location Code. Builds the full entity on the TIF data base Generates CC-NMFTM
input screen as a valid response

IDRS Terminal • Generated by CC-NMFTM with blank deﬁner, or CC-NMFTM when the full entity has been established on TIF • Displayed when the tax module is not present on TIF for the input and Tax Period, or a dummy tax module is present on TIF • Provides input ﬁelds for notice dates, the tax module transactions, dates, and amounts • Builds the full tax module on the TIF data base • Generates ‘REQUEST COMPLETE’ output screen as a valid (
) CC-NMFTM ESTABLISHMENTS: • Must be input by CSC or PSC. • Stores the Home SC Code (the SC doing the input) as the ANMF- SC-CD in the Basic Entity Record. (
) Notice History date(s) • Input using CC-NMFTM
• Must be present for the First notice • See CC-NMFTM
input screen, Element

extension dates (
) Abstract Number(s): • Are NOT input for MFT Codes that have only one abstract number • Must be input for an MFT Code with multiple Abstract Numbers • See CC-NMFTM
input screen, Element
, for the MFT Codes require Abstract ﬁelds, and the respective abstract numbers (
) Abstract amount(s): a. Tax return abstract amounts must balance with the Total Tax Amount, or the total of the input TC
Amounts (if no Total Tax Amount is present) [See CC-NMFTM
input screen, Element

] Note: Abstract Numbers with zero dollar amounts are valid. (

Are posted on TIF in the order in which they are entered on the formatted input screen (left to right, top to bottom of the screen)
• Are not consistency checked for the sequence of transaction data not checks to ensure that a reversal transaction follows the reversed transaction, or that an audit assessment follows a TC
, etc.) (
) Standard Transactions • Are transactions other than Audit/DP Adjustment, or DAR • See CC-NMFTM
input screen for values (
) The Module Balance Amount must equal the algebraic total of the input Transaction Amounts. (
) The Total Tax Liability must be input to generate Transaction Code
zero dollar amount (.
) is valid.) (
) Tax Modules are established in Status
(TDA). (Both the MF Status record, and the SC Status History record) (
) CC-NMFTM is a prerequisite for CC-NMFST. (To accommodate tax that contain more transactions, than can be input with CC-NMFTM.) (
) CC-NMFTM can not build cross-reference data. (
) CC-NMFTM can not consistency check credit transfers between two or modules. (
) ‘COMMAND CODE DEFINER INVALID’ — Command code deﬁner is not blank,
, or
) ’ACCESS DENIED —INPUT SERVICE CENTER MUST BE CSC OR PSC —Input of NMFTM is restricted to the ANMF Service Centers, which are & PSC. (
) ’ACCESS DENIED — CC IS RESTRICTED TO SBSE COMPLIANCE CMODE is being used to access a Service Center that is not SBSE. (
) ‘REQUEST DENIED - IMPROPER INITIALIZATION’ — CC-NMFTM
was preceded with a valid CC-NMFTM blank deﬁner request; or CC-NMFTM
not preceded with a valid CC-NMFTM blank deﬁner request or a valid CC- NMFTM
request. (
) ‘ID CHANGED - REINITIALIZE’ — The CC-NMFTM
or CC-NMFTM
has a TIN, MFT Code, or tax period which differs from the preceding valid input. (
) ‘TIN INVALID’ — The taxpayer identiﬁcation number is not in the proper EIN SSN edited format, or does not contain valid numeric values. (
) ‘INVALID FILE SOURCE FOR NMF’ — The input ﬁle source is not valid for NMF (other than ‘N’). (
) ‘MFT INVALID’ — The MFT Code is not valid for NMF processing per tine VALMFT (COMMON). (
) ‘MFT INCONSISTENT W/FILE SOURCE OR TIN’ — The MFT code and tax period are not consistent per subroutine VALMFT(COMMON).
CHANGED - REINITIALIZE’ — The CC-NMFTM1 or CC-NMFTM2 request a TIN, MFT Code, or tax period which differs from the preceding valid
INVALID’ — The taxpayer identiﬁcation number is not in the proper EIN or edited format, or does not contain valid numeric values.
‘MFT INCONSISTENT W/FILE SOURCE OR TIN’ — The MFT code and tax period are not consistent per subroutine VALMFT(COMMON).
or greater, the DLN must be valid for Form
QDT. For all other modules the tax period must be zeroes. (
) ‘TAX PERIOD INVALID’ — The tax period is not valid per subroutine (COMMON) or is equal to zeroes. (
) ‘TRANS AMTS OUT-OF-BAL WITH MODULE BAL’ — The running total input Transaction Amounts does not match the input (
) ‘ABST AND TC
TOTALS DO NOT BALANCE’ — The running total input Abstract-Amounts does not match the running total of the TC
Transaction-Amounts. (
) ‘REQUEST DENIED-MEMO ENTITY PRESENT’ — A memo entity exists this TIN. (
) ’INPUT SBSE-CLC IS NOT VALID’ - the numeric value is not within the CLC range (
) ‘REQUEST DENIED-MEMO MODULE PRESENT’ — A memo tax exists for the TIN, MFT-Code, and Tax-Period. (
) ‘MEMO-CODE OR MOD-MEMO-CODE ERROR ON TTF’ — The TIF Memo-Code or the TIF tax-module Mod-Memo-Code contains a value not consistent with the TIF Glossary values. (
) ‘TAXMOD ALREADY PRESENT’ — A tax module exists on TIF for the MFT-Code, and Tax-Period, which is not a dummy module. (
) ‘ENTITY BUILT ON TIF AFTER
ST CC INPUT’ — CC-NMFTM
found entity present on TIF, which was not present when deﬁner was input. CC-NMFTM-with-blank-deﬁner must be re-input to re- initialize the speciﬁc MFT-Code and Tax-Period. (
) ‘CORRECT INVALID DATA’ — Input data ﬁeld(s) indicated by an are invalid or ﬁelds may be inconsistent. Correct invalid or inconsistent and re-enter.
‘TRANS AMTS OUT-OF-BAL WITH MODULE BAL’ — The running total of the input Transaction Amounts does not match the input Module-Balance-Amount.
‘TAXMOD ALREADY PRESENT’ — A tax module exists on TIF for the TIN, MFT-Code, and Tax-Period, which is not a dummy module.

Fields that may be inconsistent: a. Primary-Name-Line and Name-Control b. State and Zip-Code c. State and Foreign-Country d. Zip-Code and Foreign-Country e. Abstract-Number and MFT-Code f. Tax-Liability-Amount and Abstract-Amounts g. Tax-Liability-Amount and Remittance-Amount h. Tax-Liability-Amount and Return-Interest-Amount i. Tax-Liability-Amount and Failure-To-Pay-Penalty-Amount j. Tax-Liability-Amount and Failure-To-File-Penalty-Amount k. Transaction-Code and MFT-Code l. Audit/DP- Adjustment-Transaction-Amount and Abstract- Amounts m. DAR-Transaction-Code is not consistent with the input Closing-Code, Deﬁner-Code, or Action-Code. Dates that may be inconsistent: a. Return-Date greater than the Input-23C-Date b. Input-23C-Date greater than the Current-23C-Date c. Standard-Transaction-Date greater than the Current-23C-Date d. Audit/DP-Adjustment-Date greater than the Input-23C-Date e. DAR-Transaction-Date greater than the Current-Date f. DAR-Extension-Date prior to the Current-Date

C-Date b. Input-
C-Date greater than the Current-
C-Date c. Standard-Transaction-Date greater than the Current-
C-Date d. Audit/DP-Adjustment-Date greater than the Input-
C-Date e. DAR-Transaction-Date greater than the Current-Date f. DAR-Extension-Date prior to the Current-Date

) ‘INFO NOTE: DUMMY ENTITY PRESENT’ — To advise that a dummy entity is present on TIF for the TIN. The terminal user can continue to establish a full entity, or terminate the input and check the account. (

) ‘INFO NOTE: DUMMY MODULE PRESENT’ — To advise that a dummy tax module is present on TIF for the TIN, MFT-Code, and Tax-Period. The terminal user can continue to establish a full tax module, or terminate the input and check the account. (
) ‘REQUEST COMPLETE’ — Successful input of the CC-NMFTM
tax module

Exhibit 2.4.11-3 (Cont. 2) NMFTM1 INPUT SCREEN
Description and Validity

Values for SSN accounts: Valid characters are alpha (A–Z), right hand bracket (]), hyphen (-), ampersand (&), and blank. First position must be alpha (A–Z). Name line may contain ﬁrst name, surname, and possibly a suffix. A right-hand bracket (]) must always precede the surname and must be present, but no more than two right-hand brackets (

) may be present. A right-hand bracket must be preceded by and followed by at least one character other than a blank or right-hand bracket (]). Any char- acters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid. Values for EIN accounts: Valid characters are alpha (A–Z),
sequential blanks are invalid. Values for EIN accounts: Valid characters are alpha numeric (
), right-hand bracket (]), hyphen (-), ampersand (&), and blank. First position must be alpha (A–Z) or numeric (

). A right-hand bracket (]) may be present, but no more than two right-hand brackets (]) may be present. A right-hand bracket must be preceded by and followed by at least one character other than a blank or right-hand bracket (]). Any characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid. Literal — (info. only) Literal — (info. only)

Description and Validity
PRIMARY NAME LINE CONTINUED — May or may not be input, as required. Maximum length is
characters. Valid characters are alpha (A–Z), numeric (
), hyphen(-), ampersand (&), and blank. Any characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid. First position must be alpha (A–Z) or numeric (

). The protected screen literal ’]’ which precedes this input ﬁeld, repre- sents a leading blank position and is required when the name line is stored on TIF. Literal — (info. only) Literal — (info. only)
SORT NAME LINE — May or may not be input, as required. Maximum length is
charac- ters. Valid characters are alpha (A–Z), numeric (
), hyphen (-), ampersand (&), and blank. Any characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid. First position must be alpha (A–Z) or numeric (
). Literal — (info. only) Literal — (info. only) CARE OF NAME LINE — May or may not be input, as required. Maximum length is
charac- ters. Valid characters are alpha (A–Z), numeric (
), hyphen (-), ampersand (&), and blank. Any characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid. First position must be alpha (A–Z) or numeric (
). The protected screen literal ’%’ and blank character which precedes the ﬁeld, are required when this name line is stored on TIF.
Exhibit 2.4.11-3 (Cont. 4) NMFTM1 INPUT SCREEN
MAILING STREET ADDRESS Must be entered. If the taxpayer does not have a street address, enter ’Local’. Maximum length is
characters. Valid characters are alpha (A–Z), numeric (
), hyphen (-), slash (/), percent (%), and blank. Any characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid.

Literal — (info. only) Literal — (info. only) MAILING CITY — Must be entered. Valid characters are alpha (A–Z) and blank. First position can not be blank, and ﬁeld must contain three valid characters. For FPO and APO addresses the city must be ’FPO’ or ’APO’. Any characters following two or more sequential blanks are invalid. Literal — (info. only) Literal — (info. only) MAILING STATE CODE — Must be entered (except foreign addresses). Must be a valid two character state abbreviation. For foreign address, can be blank, or entered as a period and blank. For FPO and APO addresses the abbreviation must be ’AA’, ’AE’, or ’AP’.

2.4.11-5 (Cont. 1) (01-01-2005) INPUT SCREEN Item Line Pos Description and Validity 1 1 1–5 COMMAND-CODE - ’NMFTM’ — Generated 2 1 6 COMMAND CODE DEFINER - ’2’ — 3 1 7–16/17 TIN — Generated 4 1 17/18 FILE SOURCE - ’N’ — Generated 5 1 21–24 Literal (for info.) 6 1 25–26 MFT CODE — Generated 7 1 27, 30–36 Literals (for info.) 8 1 37–42 TAX PERIOD —Generated 9 1 43, 46–53 Literals (for info.) 10 1 54–57 NAME CONTROL — Generated 11 1 58 Literal (for info.) 12 2 1–15 Literal (for info.) 13 2 19–23, Literals (for info.) 34–38,49–53, 64–68 14 2 NOTICE DATE — Overlay ’MMDDYYYY’ literal date of the notice issuance. The ﬁrst notice be input. Up to four notices may be present. 24–31 1st notice date (at literal 6335, posts as 501) 39–46 2nd notice date (at literal 3967, posts as 502) 54–61 3rd notice date (at literal 4839, posts as 501) 69–76 4th notice date (at literal 4840, posts as 502) 15 3 1–22 Literal (for info.) 16 3 24–30 Literal (for info.) 17 3 31–38 23C-DATE — overlay ’MMDDYYYY’. Can not quent to current 23C-DATE. 18 3 41–50 Literal (for info.) 19 3 51–58 RETURN DATE — if present, overlay Must be same or prior to 23C-DATE. 20 3 62–65 Literal (for info.) 21 3 66–79 DLN for Return — overlay ’+++++++++++’. digit numeric DLN: First two digits — valid District Office Code or Center Code
DATE — Overlay ’MMDDYYYY’ literal with the of the notice issuance. The ﬁrst notice date must input. Up to four notices may be present.
RETURN DATE — if present, overlay Must be same or prior to 23C-DATE.
DLN for Return — overlay ’+++++++++++’. Enter 14 digit numeric DLN:
First two digits — valid District Office Code or Service Center Code
Exhibit 2.4.11-5 (Cont. 2) (01-01-2005) NMFTM2 INPUT SCREEN
Description and Validity
SECURED RETURN CODE — if present, overlay ’+++’ with three digit number. Valid range is 101 to 848.
TOTAL TAX LIABILITY AMOUNT — if present, overlay currency signs ($) with the amount, beginning in the left most position. Format range is .00 through 99,999,999,999.99.
Literal (for info.)

REMITTANCE AMOUNT — if present, overlay currency signs ($) with the amount, beginning in the left most position. Format range is .00 through 999,999,999.99. Must be blank if the Total Tax Liability Amount is blank. This ﬁeld can be entered as a TC 610 though if the Total Liability Amount is blank.
Literal (for info.)

MODULE BALANCE AMOUNT — must be present. Overlay the $’s with the amount beginning in the leftmost position. Format and range is .
through

The Module Balance Amount must be equal to the algebraic sum of the Tax Liability Amount, Remittance Amount, Return Interest Amount, Return Failure to Pay Penalty Amount, Return Failure File Penalty Amount, Standard Transaction Amount(s), and Audit or DP Adjustment Transaction Amount.

MODULE BALANCE AMOUNT — must be present. Overlay the $’s with the amount beginning in the leftmost position. Format and range is .01 through 99,999,999,999.99. The Module Balance Amount must be equal to the algebraic sum of the Tax Liability Amount, Remittance Amount, Return Interest Amount, Return Failure to Pay Penalty Amount, Return Failure File Penalty Amount, Standard Transaction Amount(s), and Audit or DP Adjustment Transaction Amount.
